title: The works of Professor Wilson of the University of Edinburgh,
author: Wilson, John
snippet: and when starry midnight shone serenely over Oxford's towers and temples, sighed — vainly sighed — with unsatisfied longings  and aspirations, that would not let us rest, to " unsphere the spirit of Plato " — they too were often with us in the wide metropolis, where, wide as it is, dear friends cannot almost be for a single day but by some happy fortune they meet ! How grasped — clasped were then our hands and our hearts! How all college recollections — cheerful and full of glee — or high and of a solemn shade — came over us from the silence of those still retreats, in the noise of the restless London ! Magdalen, Mertoun, Oriel, Christchurch, Trinity — how pleasant were vour names !

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: "When I returned from Mertoun, half- frozen, I took up the Magnum, and began to notify the romance called Woodstock, in which I got some assistance from Harden's ancient tracts.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Arrived at Mertoun, and found with the family Sir John Pringle, Major Pringle, and Charles Baillie.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Anne sets off to Mertoun, and I remain alone.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: We returned from Mertoun after breakfast through an incipient snowstorm, coming on partially, and in great flakes, the sun bursting at intervals through the clouds.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: We went to dine and pass the night at Mertoun, where we met Sir John Pringle, Mr. and Mrs. Baillie Mellerstain, and their daughters.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: purchase it ! To-day we go to Mertoun, and having spent some time in making up my Journal to this length, and in a chat with Captain John, who dropped in, I will presently set to the review knock it off, if possible, before we start at five o'clock.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: I did not attempt to work, especially as we were going down to Mertoun, and set off at five o'clock.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Drove down to Mertoun and brought up Elizabeth Scott to be our guest for some days or so.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Anne, who had been at Mertoun the day before, brought up Anne and Elizabeth Scott 2 with her, and Francis has been with us since yesterday.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Went on our little expedition, breakfasting at Mertoun.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Walked from twelve till three, then drove to Mertoun with Lockhart and Allan.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: A drive down to Mertoun, and engaged to dine there on Sunday first.
